channel.title: Raw Materials on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Sodium chloride? So crazy.
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: Late last month, 11 cars were damaged—and three crushed—by a giant avalanche of salt that spilled out of a Morton’s holding facility in Chicago onto the vehicles sitting at a nearby Acura dealership. The building, which has the company’s fairly ironic slogan “When it rains it pours” emblazoned on it, suffered severe structural damage, and the mess it left behind took more than a week to clean up.
